intro: Myosotis kerneri, commonly known as the alpine forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Myosotis kerneri is part of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its hairy stems and showy flowers. Its small size and striking blossoms make it a notable species in its native high-altitude environments.
